sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个词均可表示否定"不，没有"之意。
means:
关于no与not有两点值得特别注意。
1.no用作形容词时一般直接置于名词之前。名词前有a, any, much, enough等限定词时，不可用no，应用否定副词not。no修饰名词时，语气强于not。
2.作为否定副词no与not都可与形容词比较级连用，但它们所表示的意思不相同。

example.en: Long time no see! How are you?
Whether you make it or not,it's no skin off my ass.
example.zh: 不管你做不做得成，跟我都没关系。

list.explanation: (对某人)没有影响、不起作用，说服不了(某人)，不能使(某人)相信、信服

example.en: I don't care who you are. It cuts no ice with me.
example.zh: 我不管你是谁。这与我无关。

example.en: Robert wanted to go, but we told him no soap.
example.zh: 罗伯特要想去,但我们对他说不行。

example.en: He wanted to get his money back，but it was no soap.
example.zh: 他想把钱要回来，可是没成功。

list.explanation: (指某事物)不难，不重要，没问题，不麻烦

example.en: Don't worry. It's no big deal.
What she did is no biggie.
example.zh: 她干的事没什么了不起的。

example.en: Getting a passport's no big deal.

list.explanation: (Shinola原为一种皮鞋油的牌名)你在骗人!别胡说八道!

example.en: A: So taxes are too high? B: No Shinola!
example.zh: 甲:这么说税款太高了吗？乙:别胡说八道!

list.explanation: (表示惊讶或疑问等感叹语) 是真的!不是开玩笑的!

example.zh: 戈尔德大吃一惊地说:"是真的吗？"

example.en: I told him I quite liked his pants, no shit.
example.zh: 我告诉他我很喜欢他的裤子，不是开玩笑。

entry.def: You use no to give a negative response to a question.

example.ex: 'Any problems?' — 'No, I'm O.K.'...
example.tran: “有问题吗？”——“没有，我挺好的。”

example.ex: 'Haven't you got your driver's licence?' — 'No.'
example.tran: “你难道没有拿到驾照吗？”——“没有。”

entry.def: You use no to say that something that someone has just said is not true.

example.ex: 'We thought you'd emigrated.' — 'No, no.'...
example.tran: “我们以为你移居国外了。”——“不，没有。”

example.ex: 'You're getting worse than me.' — 'No I'm not.'
example.tran: “你比我还糟。”——“不，才不是呢。”

entry.def: You use no to refuse an offer or a request, or to refuse permission.
entry.tran: (用于拒绝建议、请求或拒绝给予许可)不要，不行，不用

example.ex: 'Here, have mine.' — 'No, this is fine.'...
example.tran: “喏，用我的。”——“不用，这就挺好。”

example.ex: 'Can you just get the message through to Pete for me?' — 'No, no I can't.'...
example.tran: “你就帮我把话带给皮特，行吗？”——“不，不行，我不能。”

entry.def: You use no to indicate that you do not want someone to do something.
entry.tran: (用于表示不想让某人做某事)不要，不可

example.ex: No. I forbid it. You cannot...
example.tran: 不，我不允许那样，你不能…

example.ex: She put up a hand to stop him. 'No. It's not right. We mustn't.'
example.tran: 她举起一只手打断他的话。“不，这不对，我们绝不能这样。”

entry.def: You use no to acknowledge a negative statement or to show that you accept and understand it.
entry.tran: (表示接受或理解对方的否定说法)对的，是的

example.ex: 'We're not on the main campus.' — 'No.'...
example.tran: “我们不是在主校区。”——“是的，不在。”

example.ex: 'It's not one of my favourite forms of music.' — 'No.'
example.tran: “这不是我喜欢的音乐形式。”——“对，这不是。”

entry.def: You use no before correcting what you have just said.
entry.tran: (用于纠正刚说的话)噢不，啊不

example.ex: I was twenty-two — no, twenty-one.
example.tran: 我当时22岁，哎呀不对，是21岁。

entry.def: You use no to express shock or disappointment at something you have just been told.
entry.tran: (用于表示震惊或失望)不会吧，是吗，真的

example.ex: 'John phoned to say that his computer wasn't working.' — 'Oh God no.'
example.tran: “约翰打电话说他的电脑坏了。”——“噢，天哪，不会吧。”

example.ex: 'We went with Sarah and the married man that she's currently seeing.' — 'Oh no.'
example.tran: “我们是和萨拉还有她正在交往的那位已婚男士一起去的。”——“哦，怎么会呢。”

entry.def: You use no to mean not any or not one person or thing.

example.ex: He had no intention of paying the cash...
example.tran: 他根本没有付钱的打算。

example.ex: No job has more influence on the future of the world...
example.tran: 没有哪份工作能对世界的未来有更大的影响。

entry.def: You use no to emphasize that someone or something is not the type of thing mentioned.

example.ex: He is no singer...
example.tran: 他完全没有歌唱天分。

example.ex: I make it no secret that our worst consultants earn nothing...
example.tran: 我可以坦白地说，我们最差的顾问挣不到一分钱。

entry.def: You can use no to make the negative form of a comparative.
entry.tran: (用于构成比较级的否定形式)根本不，毫不

example.ex: It is to start broadcasting no later than the end of next year...
example.tran: 开播时间不会晚于明年年底。

example.ex: Yesterday no fewer than thirty climbers reached the summit...
example.tran: 昨天至少30名攀登者登上了顶峰。

entry.def: You use no in front of an adjective and noun to make the noun group mean its opposite.
entry.tran: (用于形容词和名词前，使其表示相反意义)倒不，并非

example.ex: Sometimes a bit of selfishness, if it leads to greater self-knowledge, is no bad thing...
example.tran: 如果能唤起更多自知之明，有时候一点点自私并非坏事。

example.ex: Today's elections are of no great importance in themselves.
example.tran: 今天的选举本身并不是很重要。

entry.def: No is used in notices or instructions to say that a particular activity or thing is forbidden.
entry.tran: (用于布告或指示中)不准，禁止

example.ex: The captain turned out the 'no smoking' signs...
example.tran: 队长把“严禁吸烟”的标志牌都翻了过来。

example.ex: No talking after lights out.
example.tran: 熄灯后禁止交谈。

entry.def: A no is a person who has answered 'no' to a question or who has voted against something. No is also used to refer to their answer or vote.
entry.tran: 作否定回答者;投反对票者;反对票

example.ex: According to the latest opinion polls, the noes have 50 percent, the yeses 35 percent...
example.tran: 根据最新的民意测验，有50％的人反对，35％的人赞成。

example.ex: French officials say the government has made contingency plans in the event that the no's win.
example.tran: 法国政府官员声称政府已经制定了应急计划，以防持异议者胜出。

entry.def: If you say there is no doing a particular thing, you mean that it is very difficult or impossible to do that thing.

example.ex: There is no going back to the life she had...
example.tran: 她无法再回到从前的生活。

example.ex: There is no doubting them now.
example.tran: 现在无法怀疑他们。

means.word_mean: 1. referring to the degree to which a certain quality is present;

sentences.sentence: "he was no heavier than a child"

means.word_mean: 2. not in any degree or manner; not at all;
3. used to express refusal or denial or disagreement etc or especially to emphasize a negative statement;

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English nō, nā (adverb), from ne 'not' + ō, ā 'ever'. The determiner arose in Middle English (originally before words beginning with any consonant except h-), reduced from non, from Old English nān (see none)
